image.altText: Woman holding plastic bottle near donation site

props.synopsis: A long-awaited Tasmanian container deposit scheme which promotes recycling will leave beverage retailers "no choice" but to pass on the cost to consumers, an industry representative says.

title.children: 'Significant impact' anticipated when recycling scheme begins

image.altText: An empty hospital bed with white sheets next to a red armchair and turquoise blue curtains

props.synopsis: Tasmanian pensioner says the system is flawed and should be means tested.

title.children: 'I have had to forego one meal a day to pay for private health insurance'

image.altText: Ambulance driving on an unidentified road.

props.synopsis: Tasmania's reliance on volunteer ambulance officers to respond to emergencies often results in paid paramedics attending jobs on their own.

title.children: Tasmania's reliance on volunteers often sees paramedics working alone

image.altText: A man in religious garb sitting in front of a red curtain, looking on

props.synopsis: As he glided around St Peter's Square in his popemobile on Sunday, the fact he was 88 and had just spent several weeks in hospital somehow seemed a distant memory. Then everything changed.

title.children: Pope Francis's final hours: A simple dinner and a meeting with an adversary

image.altText: Pope waves from wheelchair in white with red cardinals behind him

props.synopsis: Pope Francis's passing reminds us yet again of the complete absence of women in the upper echelons of the church. This is despite the fact that he did more to elevate women than any other pope.

title.children: Women still locked out of church leadership, despite huge impact on their lives

image.altText: An older man wearing glasses with grey hair delivering a speech at a conference table, looking stern.

props.synopsis: The President of the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank has demanded the militant group free the remaining 59 Israeli hostages held in Gaza and hand over its weapons.

title.children: 'You sons of dogs': Palestinian leader blasts Hamas in hostage release demand

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, there is now a conversation about an organisation called Atlas Network and whether or not it has influenced the right-bloc government's agenda.

title.children: Growing questions in NZ about an organisation called Atlas Network

image.altText: Six soldiers in camouflage holding guns stand in the back of a small car looking out

props.synopsis: The attack is the worst on civilians in the country since the 2008 Mumbai terror attack.

title.children: India closes Pakistan border crossing after fatal attack on Kashmir tourists

image.altText: A segment of a chart showing the proportion of votes going to the ALP, the LNP and 'Other candidates' at the 2022 election.

props.synopsis: This triangle is going to help us explain how Australian politics has fundamentally changed over the past five decades.

title.children: This triangle helps explain a titanic shift in how Australia votes

image.altText: Pauline Hanson cocks her head to the side while looking down her nose between the shoulders of two men

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's most striking populist figures are again at odds; this time, over preference deals. Here's how it could influence the election.

title.children: Preference deals could change who wins in some seats

image.altText: The Apple tech company logo of an apple is illuminated in white against a black background

props.synopsis: The two tech giants were fined by the European Union's watchdogs as they step up enforcement of digital competition rules.

title.children: Apple fined $890m and Meta $356m for breaching new EU laws

image.altText: Online gambling generics man with phone

props.synopsis: The Coalition says if elected they will create a national database of domestic violence offenders and introduce other measures to tackle the abuse epidemic.

title.children: Coalition unveils $90m domestic violence strategy

image.altText: Woman wearing high vis vest passes box of produce to woman wearing red puffer jacket over the counter

props.synopsis: Green waste bins are supposed to reduce the amount of organic matter going to landfill, and in Geelong, it's also feeding residents.

title.children: What happens to the waste in our green bins? In Geelong, it's feeding the community

image.altText: A woman sitting down next to dogs.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian pet owners who say their dogs suffered adverse effects or died after receiving an osteoarthritis treatment are working to launch a class action, after a lawsuit was filed in the United States.

title.children: Pet owners consider class action over osteoarthritis drug

image.altText: Four women in traditional attire stand next to a portrait of JD Vance

props.synopsis: Despite warm relations with Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, US President Donald Trump has slammed the South Asian country as a "tariff abuser".

title.children: 'Prosperous and peaceful': JD Vance calls on India to buy more F-35 fighters

image.altText: Elon Musk sits in the Oval Office wearing a red baseball cap that says: "Trump was right about everything"

props.synopsis: Tesla boss Elon Musk will cut back on his commitment to the Trump administration's DOGE and recommit to the carmaker, in a move cheered by investors after what analysts have called a "disaster" result.

title.children: Tesla investors cheer 'beginning of the end' of Musk’s White House stint

image.altText: People gather outdoors following an earthquake shock

props.synopsis: The earthquake has injured more than 150 people and is centred in the Sea of Marmara at a shallow depth of 10 kilometres.

title.children: Powerful 6.2 magnitude earthquake hits Istanbul with more than 150 injured

image.altText: a young male politician speaking in front of a blue background

props.synopsis: Senior opposition figure Andrew Hastie has warned Australia's long-standing military alliance with the United States faces uncertainty under President Donald Trump's "unpredictable" America First agenda.

title.children: Coalition warns Australia can't take US alliance for granted under Trump

image.altText: a man wearing a suit arriving at a court and looking at the camera

props.synopsis: The former SAS soldier has accused Nine journalist Nick McKenzie of improper access to his legal strategy during the long-running defamation case.

title.children: Lawyers for Ben Roberts-Smith lob accusations at Nine journalist

image.altText: An out of focus man looks at plants while pushing a trolley in a nursery.

props.synopsis: Bunnings plant suppliers will now have written agreements under a new statement of principles designed to protect growers, following complaints about the hardware giant during last year's supermarket inquiry.

title.children: Bunnings strikes deal with plant growers fearful of 'retribution'

image.altText: a ute in water

props.synopsis: The ACCC alleges that in advertising cars driving through water and rough terrains, LDV has misrepresented their "durability".

title.children: Consumer watchdog takes LDV to court for alleged misleading advertising

image.altText: police officers tape off a crime scene

props.synopsis: An elderly man is in hospital after being allegedly punched by a teenager outside a polling booth in Sydney's inner west.

title.children: Teen charged for allegedly punching elderly man at Sydney polling booth

image.altText: Lani Pallister looks down the pool

props.synopsis: Lani Pallister only started to swim distance events because she made a mistake with a highlighter. It has turned out to be the best mistake she ever made.

title.children: Accidental distance queen Pallister wins 400m freestyle

image.altText: Anthony Albanese holds up a Medicare card as he speaks animatedly.

props.synopsis: Time and time again, the Coalition has been forced to deny claims about plans to privatise Australia's healthcare system.

title.children: PM has been brandishing a Medicare card and Dutton is reaping what he sowed

image.altText: A graphic featuring post-it notes and cash imposed over a map of NSW

props.synopsis: Housing affordability weighs heavily on voters in a NSW Central Coast seat that has been won by the party that goes on to form government at every election since 1983.

title.children: For more than 40 years, whoever wins this seat wins the election

image.altText: Noah Balta of Richmond warms up preapring to collect a bouncing ball

props.synopsis: Richmond's Noah Balta speaks for the first time since his sentencing for an assault charge, expressing his remorse and apologising to the victim.

title.children: 'Violence is never the answer': Balta speaks for first time since sentencing

image.altText: Asian Elephant

props.synopsis: Sydney's beloved Asian elephant pair is preparing for a new life with a herd on the plains of South Australia.

title.children: After a century in Sydney, Taronga Zoo says goodbye to its elephants

image.altText: A crashed car on a stretch of highway. Ared car nearby and a fire truck.

props.synopsis: No bail application for a Sunshine Coast man facing 15 charges over a fatal crash, shooting and string of alleged carjackings on Monday.

title.children: Driver accused of fatal Sunshine Coast carjackings to stay behind bars

image.altText: A middle-aged man in a dark suit stands at a podium and holds up a document.

props.synopsis: The Shire of Coolgardie has confirmed the resignation of long-standing chief executive James Trail as an investigation into issues at the council continues.

title.children: Suspended WA council CEO resigns as workplace probe continues

image.altText: Conor Nash watches Gryan Miers hobble off

props.synopsis: Hawthorn's Conor Nash is handed a four-game suspension by the AFL tribunal for a hit that left Geelong's Gryan Miers concussed.

title.children: 'Genuinely remorseful' Nash suspended for four weeks for Miers hit

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: Experts' practical advice on keeping mozzies away when you're outdoors or at home.

title.children: How to avoid serious mosquito-borne viruses like Japanese encephalitis

props.synopsis: After the death of Pope Francis, Catholics around the world are reckoning with the future of the church. Australia's congregation has been shifting and changing with the times.

title.children: The percentage of Catholics in Australia is headed for an all-time low

image.altText: An artists image of a white-water facility.

props.synopsis: Opponents of a whitewater centre planned for south-east Queensland say they've "drawn the short straw" on Olympic venues.

title.children: 'It's got no water': Councillors and locals question Olympic canoe venue

image.altText: A black and white photo of Australian cricketer Keith Stackpole.

props.synopsis: Former Australia Test opener Keith Stackpole dies, aged 84, after a dynamic career including seven centuries and a brilliant Ashes double ton.

title.children: Keith Stackpole remembered as 'a fantastic cricketer and a great bloke'
